trans-unit.source: user.getIdentities(<parameterReference>options</parameterReference>)
trans-unit.target: user.getIdentities(<parameterReference>options</parameterReference>)

trans-unit.source: undefined
trans-unit.target: undefined

trans-unit.source: Asynchronously accesses identity information for the logged-in user.
trans-unit.target: Asynchronously accesses identity information for the logged-in user.

trans-unit.source: This function takes an <parameterReference>options</parameterReference> parameter, which is used to supply a <parameterReference>success</parameterReference> and <parameterReference>error</parameterReference> callback functions, as follows:
trans-unit.target: This function takes an <parameterReference>options</parameterReference> parameter, which is used to supply a <parameterReference>success</parameterReference> and <parameterReference>error</parameterReference> callback functions, as follows:

trans-unit.source: After a user has been authenticated, <token>nextref_zumo</token> passes to the <parameterReference>success</parameterReference> function an <languageKeyword>identities</languageKeyword> object, which contains the following fields:
trans-unit.target: After a user has been authenticated, <token>nextref_zumo</token> passes to the <parameterReference>success</parameterReference> function an <languageKeyword>identities</languageKeyword> object, which contains the following fields:

trans-unit.source: An error object is supplied to the <parameterReference>error</parameterReference> callback function when an error occurs.
trans-unit.target: An error object is supplied to the <parameterReference>error</parameterReference> callback function when an error occurs.

trans-unit.source: The error callback function is optional.
trans-unit.target: The error callback function is optional.

trans-unit.source: <token>nextref_zumo</token> is able to automatically retrieve additional user information from your identity provider.
trans-unit.target: <token>nextref_zumo</token> is able to automatically retrieve additional user information from your identity provider.

trans-unit.source: For more information about how to enable and use this preview functionality, see the <externalLink><linkText>Enhanced users feature</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=389946</linkUri></externalLink> blog post.
trans-unit.target: For more information about how to enable and use this preview functionality, see the <externalLink><linkText>Enhanced users feature</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=389946</linkUri></externalLink> blog post.

trans-unit.source: user.getIdentities()
trans-unit.target: user.getIdentities()

trans-unit.source: The synchronous version of <languageKeyword>getIdentities</languageKeyword> has been deprecated.
trans-unit.target: The synchronous version of <languageKeyword>getIdentities</languageKeyword> has been deprecated.

trans-unit.source: Please use the asynchronous version that takes an <parameterReference>options</parameterReference> parameter of success and error callback functions.
trans-unit.target: Please use the asynchronous version that takes an <parameterReference>options</parameterReference> parameter of success and error callback functions.

trans-unit.source: Synchronously requests a JavaScript Object Notation (JSON) object that contains identity information, in the following format:
trans-unit.target: Synchronously requests a JavaScript Object Notation (JSON) object that contains identity information, in the following format:

trans-unit.source: The <parameterReference>access_token_secret_value</parameterReference> may not be available for all identity providers.
trans-unit.target: The <parameterReference>access_token_secret_value</parameterReference> may not be available for all identity providers.

trans-unit.source: accessTokens
trans-unit.target: accessTokens

trans-unit.source: A JavaScript Object Notation (JSON) object that contains the access token, in the following format:
trans-unit.target: A JavaScript Object Notation (JSON) object that contains the access token, in the following format:

trans-unit.source: level
trans-unit.target: level

trans-unit.source: The level of authentication, which can be one of the following:
trans-unit.target: The level of authentication, which can be one of the following:

trans-unit.source: <languageKeyword>admin</languageKeyword>: the master key was included in the request.
trans-unit.target: <languageKeyword>admin</languageKeyword>: the master key was included in the request.

trans-unit.source: <languageKeyword>anonymous</languageKeyword>: a valid authentication token was not provided in the request.
trans-unit.target: <languageKeyword>anonymous</languageKeyword>: a valid authentication token was not provided in the request.

trans-unit.source: <languageKeyword>authenticated</languageKeyword>: a valid authentication token was provided in the request.
trans-unit.target: <languageKeyword>authenticated</languageKeyword>: a valid authentication token was provided in the request.

trans-unit.source: userId
trans-unit.target: userId

trans-unit.source: The user ID of an authenticated user.
trans-unit.target: The user ID of an authenticated user.

trans-unit.source: When a user is not authenticated, this property returns <embeddedLabel>undefined</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: When a user is not authenticated, this property returns <embeddedLabel>undefined</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: Scripts registered to table operations are always passed an instance of the <languageKeyword>user</languageKeyword> object, regardless of whether the operation is authenticated.
trans-unit.target: Scripts registered to table operations are always passed an instance of the <languageKeyword>user</languageKeyword> object, regardless of whether the operation is authenticated.

trans-unit.source: In a custom API, the <languageKeyword>user</languageKeyword> object is accessed from the <link xlink:href="6f77cfad-b160-447b-b170-c62e6987d819" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Request object</link> supplied to the function.
trans-unit.target: In a custom API, the <languageKeyword>user</languageKeyword> object is accessed from the <link xlink:href="6f77cfad-b160-447b-b170-c62e6987d819" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Request object</link> supplied to the function.
